Docs.summary: Coordinates an audio playback or capture session.

remarks.para: Application developers should use the singleton object retrieved by .

Because the audio hardware of an iOS device is shared between all apps, audio settings can only be "preferred" (see SetPreferred* methods) and the application developer must account for use-cases where these preferences are overridden.
The interaction of an app with other apps and system services is determined by your audio category. You can use the method to set this
You should also control the Mode (using to describe how your application will use audio.

As is common in AV Foundation, many methods in are asynchronous and properties may take some time to reflect their final status. Application developers should be familiar with asynchronous programming techniques.
The , like the and is a coordinating object between some number of and .
You can register to a few notifications that are posted by the audio system, by using the convenience methods in .
